question_content.description:
### Problem10


- As defined at the end of Section 3.1, an object from a data type is _____(0)\___ if its data-type value cannot change once created.
- Generally, immutable types are _____(1)\___ (easier/harder) to use and _____(2)\___ (easier/harder) to misuse because the scope of code that can change their values is far smaller than for mutable types.It is _____(3)\___ (easier/harder) to debug code that uses immutable types because it is _____(4)\___ (easier/harder) to guarantee that variables in the client code that uses them will remain in a consistent state. 
The downside of immutability is that a new _____(5)\___ must be created for every value (literally from sec-3.3).
question_content.author: Yantao_Mei
